page.title: 14ASTON HALL
page.content: An important feature of the village of Aston-by-Stone is Aston Hall. When the estate was given to Robert de Toeni the Hall was a moated manor house. It has been a home of Catholic life for over a thousand years. The present Hall dates back to about 1850 and is now a delightful home for retired and convalescent priests. They are looked after by a community of sisters of Charity of St. Paul. There has however been a house here since Saxon times. Nearby is the 'home' farm on the Aston Estate namely Aston Hall Farm. It now has a total acreage of 350 acres and keeps beef cattle and sheep.
